newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian sugar market closed for holiday.
newsitem.headline: Indian sugar market closed for holiday.

text.p: The Bombay sugar market was closed for a local holiday. Trading resumes on Friday.
On Wednesday, sugar prices rose on a shortages of ready stock, triggering speculative buying but consumer demand dried up at the higher levels.
Ready sugar S-30 rose 10/15 rupees to 1,390/1,440 rupees per quintal while sugar M-30 settled five rupees higher at 1,440/1,505 rupees per quintal.
Sugar mill delivery moved up 5.0 rupees to 1,340/1,360 rupees per quintal. --Bombay Commodities +91-22-265 9000
